Sentencas: The morphological and chemical modifications following reduction in hydrogen at 873 K of stannic oxide deposited on ceria particles were studied in order to gain insights into the nature of Ce-Sn interaction under reducing atmosphere, simulating the operating conditions in a solid oxide fuel cell.
Titulo: Structural and electrocatalytic properties of molten core Sn@SnOx nanoparticles on ceria

Sentencas: It is shown that the co-presence of the two materials improves the power output of fuel cells up to a factor of 10 when compared to ceria alone.
Titulo: Structural and electrocatalytic properties of molten core Sn@SnOx nanoparticles on ceria

Sentencas: Through high resolution transmission electron microscopy (HRTEM), X-ray photoelectron spectroscopy (XPS), and in-situ X-ray diffraction (XRD) data we show the formation of a novel system made up of nanoparticles composed of a molten Sn-0 core capped by an amorphous tin oxide layer.
Titulo: Structural and electrocatalytic properties of molten core Sn@SnOx nanoparticles on ceria

Sentencas: SnOx shell acts as a binding agent which stabilizes Sn-0 nanoparticles on ceria even after reductive treatment at temperatures well above the melting point of tin.
Titulo: Structural and electrocatalytic properties of molten core Sn@SnOx nanoparticles on ceria

Sentencas: This occurs through an interfacial redox communication between ceria and tin, likely involving a transfer of oxygen from ceria to the metal and electrons from metal to ceria.
Titulo: Structural and electrocatalytic properties of molten core Sn@SnOx nanoparticles on ceria

Sentencas: It is highlighted how the Sn@SnOx nanostructures and their spontaneous formation could be used as a model for the development of catalyst nano-assembly comprising an amorphous metal oxide triple phase boundary, opening the way for a new paradigm in the development of multifunctional catalytic systems.
Titulo: Structural and electrocatalytic properties of molten core Sn@SnOx nanoparticles on ceria
